security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document contains payroll records and related forms for Gina I. Resnick, an employee of the HSCA, including her appointment, salary adjustments, and termination, as well as memoranda regarding her employment and payroll certification.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection of documents pertains to Gina I. Resnick's employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from June 1977 to January 1978. It includes payroll authorization forms detailing her appointments as a Document Clerk, salary adjustments, and eventual termination, with Louis Stokes as the authorizing official. A personal leave record outlines her leave usage, and internal memoranda detail her qualifications, hiring recommendation, and the requirement for payroll certification regarding relationships to members of Congress. The Assassination Records Review Board has postponed the release of Social Security numbers within these documents, citing privacy concerns.
title: Staff Payroll Records Regarding Gina I. Resnick
recipient: Clerk of the House of Representatives
sender: Louis Stokes, Chairman; Tom Lambeth, Acting Staff Director
